column4: i noe pptp is not as secure, but i have no choice 'cos thats the only thing i noe so far
although i got it work, but my client is not able to see the PCs in the LAN
not known yet, cos the setup of the company is still small
how do I get in contact with you?
you need to set up a secure vpn?
well, keep in mind, pptp can have a 48 bit cipher associated with it, i think. is that not enough?
ok, so how is pptp unsuitable? the only reason pptp is good is because it dosen't require anything special for microsoft clients
do you have forwarding between interfaces enabled?
i mean, basically, you need to have routes established unless you are doing an ARP proxy to put VPN clients on the same subnet.
is your VPN box your gateway for 192.168.123.x and 10.0.x.x ?
